steps.title: Diagnostic Plan
steps.description: Baseline speaking + targeted checklist → CEFR-aligned plan for your exact goal (exam / career / migration).

steps.title: Talk-First Lessons
steps.description: ~70% you speaking; role-plays from your life; live "say-it-better" loops; micro-drills that fix your errors.

steps.title: Practice & Proof
steps.description: 5–10 min tasks between lessons, voice-note feedback, and progress checkpoints at 30/60/90 days with before/after audio.

profile.title: Certified Expertise. Proven Results.
profile.subtitle: Official examiner credentials with measurable student outcomes

items.question: How many lessons per week?
items.answer: Most adults do 2×50-min or 3×25-min. We'll match cadence to your deadline (exam date/migration timeline).

items.question: Do you provide materials?
items.answer: Yes—curated, level-appropriate content plus original materials (incl. textbook co-authored by the tutor) and targeted drills.

items.question: Can you register me for exams?
items.answer: I prepare you and advise on dates/centers; you register and pay the exam center directly.

items.question: Will we only do speaking?
items.answer: Speaking is the core (70%), but every plan includes listening, reading, writing, and pronunciation—weighted to your goal (DELF/DALF/TEF or workplace needs).

items.question: Do you teach groups?
items.answer: Yes. Small groups for exam tracks; 1:1 remains the fastest path for tight deadlines.

items.question: What's your background?
items.answer: DALF C2; official DELF-DALF & TEF examiner; former director at Alliance Française Bishkek; university + international school experience.
